intro: Dischidia crassula, commonly known as the Bubble Vine, is a climbing or trailing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often followed by red or orange berries. It is well adapted to humid, tropical environments and thrives in partial shade. Its unique appearance and ease of care make it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardening.
